getXspProperty

public static java.lang.String[] getXspProperty(java.lang.String propertyName)
Gets an Xsp property. Order of execution is:
  1. xsp.properties in NSF
  2. xsp.properties on Server
  3. System.getProperty
  4. notes.ini
  5. default value passed in

Parameters:
propertyName - property to retrieve
defaultValue - default value to use if the property can't be found anywhere else
Returns:
String array of property, split on commas
Since:
org.openntf.domino 2.5.0

getXspPropertyAsString

public static java.lang.String getXspPropertyAsString(java.lang.String propertyName)
Gets an Xsp Property, returning just the basic string as seen in the xsp.properties file. Order of execution is:
  1. xsp.properties in NSF
  2. xsp.properties on Server
  3. System.getProperty
  4. notes.ini

Parameters:
propertyName - Property name to look for
Returns:
String property value or an empty string
Since:
org.openntf.domino.xsp 4.5.0
